info.title: OPENBOOK API by Universelle
info.description: This is the OPENBOOK API Documentation by Universelle

get.summary: GET a paginated list of atomic swaps sorted by block
GET a paginated list of atomic swaps by tx id
GET a paginated list of atomic swaps by asset
GET a paginated list of atomic swaps where address is the seller, buyer, or service fee recipient
GET a paginated list of unique addresses that have participated in atomic swaps
GET a paginated list of unique addresses that have participated in atomic swaps by type (seller, buyer)
GET a paginated list of blocks with a summary of the event counts happening in this block and an array of important transactions (atomic swaps or order listings)

enum: The number of events happening in this block
The relevant transactions happening in this block (atomic swaps or order listings/cancelling)

get.summary: GET a list of blocks grouped by day with the sum of events happening in each block of this day

enum: The number of events happening in this block
The relevant transactions happening in this block (atomic swaps or order listings/cancelling)

post.summary: POST a request to attach a counterparty asset to an UTXO using Counterparty

enum: The BTC input for the attaching.
The BTC output for the attaching.
The miners fee for the attaching.

post.summary: POST a request to detach a counterparty asset from an UTXO using Counterparty

enum: The BTC input for the detaching.
The BTC output for the detaching.
The miners fee for the detaching.

get.summary: GET UTXOs for a given address including UTXOS with balances
This method will return a paginated list of onchain orders

enum: Succesful response with a list of orders
The txId of the order TX. This is the main identifier for the order.
The timestamp of the block containing the order.
The index of the block containing the order.
The utxo used for the order that contains the assets.
The PSBT of the order that needs to be fulfilled for finishing the swap.
The quantity of the assetId attached to that utxo.
The protocol of the asset, 0 for COUNTERPARTY
The name of the protocol, COUNTERPARTY

get.summary: This method will return an onchain order by its txId

enum: The txId of the order TX. This is the main identifier for the order.
The timestamp of the block containing the order.
The index of the block containing the order.
The utxo used for the order that contains the assets.
The PSBT of the order that needs to be fulfilled for finishing the swap.
The quantity of the assetId attached to that utxo.
The protocol of the asset, 0 for COUNTERPARTY
The name of the protocol, COUNTERPARTY

get.summary: This method will return a paginated list of onchain orders that contains an specific asset

enum: Succesful response with a list of orders
The txId of the order TX. This is the main identifier for the order.
The timestamp of the block containing the order.
The index of the block containing the order.
The utxo used for the order that contains the assets.
The PSBT of the order that needs to be fulfilled for finishing the swap.
The quantity of the assetId attached to that utxo.
The protocol of the asset, 0 for COUNTERPARTY
The name of the protocol, COUNTERPARTY

get.summary: This method will return a paginated list of onchain orders that are created by an specific seller address.

enum: The txId of the order TX. This is the main identifier for the order.
The timestamp of the block containing the order.
The index of the block containing the order.
The utxo used for the order that contains the assets.
The PSBT of the order that needs to be fulfilled for finishing the swap.
The quantity of the assetId attached to that utxo.
The protocol of the asset, 0 for COUNTERPARTY
The name of the protocol, COUNTERPARTY

post.summary: This is the first step for create a lsting order, this will return a PSBT for signing the order, this method has not any cost for the user.

enum: The utxo used for the listing.

post.summary: This is the second step for create a lsting order, this will rquire a PSBT signed for the order using the previous step (/api/v1/orders/list/sign), this method will return a full signed tx with the listing info attached, this method will incur a miners fee for the listing.

enum: The btc that the user will be using for the listing.
The btc that the user will spend from the listing + the bitcoin will receive.
The btc that the user will receive from the listing.
The miners fee used for the listing.

post.summary: this method will create and return a buy transaction for an order

enum: The txid of the order to buy.
The fee rate for the buy transaction.
The service fee for the buy transaction.
The inputs to sign for the buy transaction.
The index of the imput to sign.
The sighash type of the input.
The miners fee for the buy transaction.
The btc that the user will be using for the buy.
The btc that the user will spend from the buy + the bitcoin will receive.
The btc that the user will receive from the buy.
The expected fee for the buy transaction.
The base size of the buy.

post.summary: this method will cancel an order by spending the utxo of the order and sending it to the seller address, this method will incur a miners fee for the cancel.

enum: The inputs to sign for the cancel transaction.
The index of the imput to sign.
The sighash type of the input.
The miners fee for the cancel transaction.
The btc that the user will be using for the cancel.
The btc that the user will spend from the cancel + the bitcoin will receive.
The btc that the user will receive from the cancel.
The expected fee for the cancel transaction.
The base size of the cancel.
